intro: Argostemma denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed argostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with finely toothed edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in umbels, and bloom in the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
